books.title: Start with Why
books.author: Simon Sinek
books.description: Focuses on purpose-driven leadership. Why do some leaders inspire while others just manage? This book helps you lead with clarity and conviction.

books.title: Just One Cookbook
books.author: Namiko Chen
books.description: Perfect for beginners! Clear, step-by-step instructions with photos. Great for everyday Japanese home cooking like teriyaki, miso soup, and onigiri.

books.title: Kimi ni Todoke
books.author: Karuho Shiina
books.description: A sweet, heartwarming story about a shy girl misunderstood because of her appearance, who gradually opens up and finds friendship and love with the class heartthrob.

books.title: The Japanese Larder
books.author: Luiz Hara
books.description: Bringing Japanese Ingredients into Your Everyday Cooking

books.title: Horimiya
books.author: HERO & Daisuke Hagiwara
books.description: Behind closed doors, Hori is a homebody and Miyamura hides tattoos and piercings — their unexpected friendship grows into a tender romance full of charm and laughs.

books.title: Leaders Eat Last
books.author: Simon Sinek
books.description: Explores how great leaders create environments where people feel safe and valued. Uses biology, real-world examples, and military analogies. A must-read for building trust-based teams.

books.title: Japanese Soul Cooking
books.author: Tadashi Ono & Harris Salat
books.description: Japanese Soul Cooking: Ramen, Tonkatsu, Tempura, and More from the Streets and Kitchens of Tokyo and Beyond

books.title: Lovely★Complex
books.author: Aya Nakahara
books.description: A tall girl and a short boy form a comedic duo — but when romance sparks, their height difference (and pride) makes things hilariously complicated.

books.title: Dare to Lead
books.author: Brené Brown
books.description: Empathy, vulnerability, courage — not your typical leadership playbook. Great for human-centered leadership in teams, organizations, and creative work.

books.title: The Journey of Elaina (Majo no Tabitabi)
books.author: Jougi Shiraishi & Itsuki Nanao
books.description: A graceful traveling witch explores different countries, each with unique cultures and stories. Romance is subtle and rare, but the themes of longing and connection run deep.

books.title: Tonari no Kaibutsu-kun (My Little Monster)
books.author: Robico
books.description: A studious girl and a troublemaker boy form an unusual bond that slowly develops into something more, mixing awkward moments with sweet emotion.

books.title: Ao Haru Ride
books.author: Io Sakisaka
books.description: High school romance with a second-chance twist — Futaba reunites with her first love, Kou, only to find he’s completely changed. Can they reconnect?

books.title: The Book of Tea
books.author: Kakuzō Okakura
books.description: A philosophical exploration of the Japanese tea ceremony and how it reflects Zen and Taoist values.

books.title: Wabi Sabi: Japanese Wisdom for a Perfectly Imperfect Life
books.author: Beth Kempton
books.description: A modern introduction to the ancient concept of wabi sabi — the beauty of things imperfect, impermanent, and incomplete.
